name: Atiyah conjecture
rephrased: Are the l²-Betti numbers, defined as von Neumann dimensions of l²-cohomology groups for spaces with a discrete countable group's free co-compact action, always rational numbers?
solved_by: Unsolved in general (though solved in many specific cases)
explained: The Atiyah conjecture concerns the rationality of l²-Betti numbers, which are invariants defined using l²-cohomology. It posits that for a compact manifold with a free, co-compact action by a discrete countable group, the l²-Betti numbers of the universal cover are rational numbers. Equivalently, it asks whether these invariants, defined via von Neumann dimensions, are always rational in this context.
